subject: Re: ¿How to informs about the name of the test case method on the output?
msgSnippet: With the help of: J.B. Rainsberger I have found a solution to may problem: Using the following class, on the class you will find the documentation about how to
messageBody:
With the help of: J.B. Rainsberger I have found a solution to may
problem:
Using the following class, on the class you will find the
documentation about how to use it:

//Source file: I:\\junit\\testui\\PrintResultDecorated.java

/**
CmIdentification
/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
///////////
// Version History:
$Log$
/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
///////////
*/

/**
Copyright
//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
//////////
//
// Copyright (c) 2000 Unión Fenosa - Soluziona - S.A. All Rights
Reserved.
//
//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
//////////
//
// This software is the confidential and proprietary information of
// Union Fenosa - Soluziona S.A.. You shall not disclose such
confidential
// information and shall not accordance with the terms of the license
// agreements you entered into with Union Fenosa - Soluziona S.A..
//
//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
//////////
*/

package junit.textui;

import java.io.PrintStream;
import java.util.Collections;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Map;

import junit.framework.AssertionFailedError;
import junit.framework.Test;
import junit.framework.TestCase;

/**
Prints the trace information during the execution of the test and
informs
about the its result.

The output of the test will look like this:
<pre>
testGetInstance_exist(com.ams.common.enum.ActionTest) ... OK
testEquals_false(com.ams.common.enum.ActionTest) ... ERROR
testToString(com.ams.common.enum.ActionTest) ... FAILED
</pre>
<p> where the first information is the name of the test, and the
second information
is its result after the execution. The information is printed in the
order
the test are executed.</p>

In order to use this decorator you have to invoke the test runner in
the
following way:
<pre>
public static void main (String[] args){
// Using another printer
junit.textui.TestRunner runner
= new junit.textui.TestRunner(
new ResultPrinterDecorated
(System.out));
runner.doRun(suite());
}
</pre>
<p>Note that we are invoking <code>doRun()</code> instead of the
method
<code>run()</code>, which is not <code>static</code>.</p>
<p>The static method <code>suite()</code> is defined as usual, if you
don't
want to use this decorator, simply invoke the runner like this:</p>
<pre>junit.textui.TestRunner.run(suite());</pre>

@version $Revison$
@author <a href="mailto:dleal@...">David Leal Valmaña (DLE)
</a>
@invariant $none
*/
public class ResultPrinterDecorated extends ResultPrinter {
/**
Stores the result of each test passed.
*/
private Map tests =
Collections.synchronizedMap(new HashMap(1001));
/**
Constructor, it just invokes the parent contructor.
@pre $none
@post $none
*/
public ResultPrinterDecorated(PrintStream writer) {
super(writer);
}

/**
Controls the information to be printed at the begining of each
test case. It just prints the name of the test and ellipsis
indicating
the test is running.
@pre test != null
@post $none
*/
public void startTest(Test test) {
tests.put(test, Boolean.TRUE);
getWriter().print(test.toString() + " ... ");
}

/**
Controls the information to be printed at the end of the test.
If the test is passed, it prints the word: <code>OK</code> in
a line, otherwise it just print an empty new line.
@pre test != null
@post $none
*/
public void endTest(Test test) {
Boolean passed = (Boolean) tests.get(test);
if (passed == Boolean.TRUE) {
getWriter().println("OK");
}
else {
getWriter().println();
}
}

/**
When an error is found, it prints the word: <code>ERROR</code>
on the
same line and computes this test as failed.
@pre test != null
@post $none
*/
public void addError(Test test, Throwable t) {
tests.put(test, Boolean.FALSE);
getWriter().print("ERROR");
}
/**
When a fail is found, it prints the word: <code>FAILED</code> on
the
same line and computes this test as failed.
@pre test != null
@post $none
*/

public void addFailure(Test test, AssertionFailedError t) {
tests.put(test, Boolean.FALSE);
getWriter().print("FAILED");
}
}
